 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְנִי‎</span> **proper name, of a divinity** ==Menî, god of fate== (***award, apportionment***; compare Arabic proper name, of divinity. <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***Maniyyât***</u></abbr>, and perhaps <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***Manât***</u></abbr>, [[BDB#We|We]]<sup>Skizzen iii.22 f.</sup> 189, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, [[BDB#Nö|Nö]]<sup>ZMG xi. 1886, 709</sup>; in Nabataean <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מנותו‎</span> [[BDB#Eut|Eut]]<sup>Nab. No. 2, 1. 5, etc</sup>.); — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִלֵּא לַמְנִי מִמְסָךְ‎</span> [[Isa.65.11|Isa 65:11]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לַגַּד‎</span>) — see [[BDB#Che|Che]] [[BDB#Di|Di]] [[BDB#Bae|Bae]]<sup>Semitic Rel. 79</sup>.
